sentence.Network_en: Insularity and self - containment, it is argued, go hand in hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们争论说, 心胸狭窄和 自我 封闭是并存的.

sentence.Network_en: Their approaches to last Saturday night's 100 m races were similar only in insularity.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们上周六晚100米赛跑的备战策略大体相同。

sentence.Network_en: The cultural insularity of music today is not simply the consequence of deficient pedagogy or propagation.
sentence.Network_cn: 今日音乐的文化隔绝状态并不简单是教育和传播的缺乏引起的.

entry.tran: 孤立的;保守的;思想狭隘的
entry.def: If you say that someone is insular, you are being critical of them because they are unwilling to meet new people or to consider new ideas.

example.ex: ...the old image of the insular, xenophobic Brit.
example.tran: 孤立保守而又恐外的英国人的旧有形象

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being isolated or detached;

sentences.sentence: "the insulation of England was preserved by the English Channel"

auth_sentence.content: In France the core irrationality is not its insularity.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: In France the core irrationality is not its insularity.

auth_sentence.content: Our insularity was two-fold, being a matter of religion as well as nationality.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our insularity was two-fold, being a matter of religion as well as nationality.

auth_sentence.content: The...artists who received the largesse of the Whitlam regime seem...to represent a return to insularity.
